Description: Body sherd of small Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice with part of handle; white slip (mostly worn); interior glazed streaky black (partly worn); traces of faded added white bands; exterior: glaze (fired red) on top of handle; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The loss of slip on the exterior surface makes it very difficult to determine to what style the sherd belongs; absence of interior decoration may suggest that it belongs to a patterned chalice.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0945) (phase 2)
